channel.title: Ubuntu Linux
channel.description: How do I run the Rs2 Server Client on an Ubuntu Linux?

item.title: Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

You are an Idiot. Java works on linux, and a batch file is for the command line on windows.

Open up Terminal, and try java -version. If that works your probably good to go. Use cd to change to the server’s directory, javac *.java to compile, and then use the java command with whatever parameters are in the batch file and it should run.
My server will run on Mac, Windows, and Linux. I have Mac and Windows and my friend has a laptop running Ubuntu.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @sriyegna sriyegna
item.description:
@sriyegna wrote:

well… first of all, u cant run batch files on linux so tht means u cant run any .bat… u cant run a server :(. You may be able to do it if u install WINE through the synaptic package manager…

yehh, u can host it on any windows and fedora tho, so i reccomend u chek those out
